channel.title: ci/cd on Matias Pan's blog
channel.description: Recent content in ci/cd on Matias Pan's blog

item.title: Exploring Dagger: Streamlining CI/CD Pipelines with Code â€“ A Developer's Guide
item.description: This is the second post in a series of blog posts that look at Dagger from different perspectives. In this post we do a deep dive on how to leverage Dagger as a developer that is tasked with implementing the CI process of a Java-Gradle service. In this CI process we need to: build, run integration tests with external dependencies and package the service. We will leave the CD part for a future blog post that looks at Dagger from the perspective of a Platform Engineer/SRE.

item.title: Exploring Dagger: Building a CI/CD pipeline for IaC
item.description: Dagger is a new tool that promises to fix the yaml and custom scripts mess that CI/CD currently is by building pipelines as code with one of the supported SDKs. I’m in the process of learning this tool, understanding where it may fall short and where it shines and I decided that sharing some of the exploration I do and the learnings it leaves me with would be useful. This is the first post in a series of blog posts that look at Dagger from different perspectives.
